@graph.name: Parks Core Activities
@graph.description: Categorization of amusement parks based on their core offer: Attractions, Exhibitions, Retail, Shows, Wildlife.

hasBranch.name: Attractions
hasBranch.description: The variety of mechanical rides and interactive entertainment offerings like roller coasters, water rides, and themed rides.

example.name: Thrill Seekers Paradise
example.description: Features some of the tallest and fastest roller coasters in the world, alongside family-friendly rides and interactive games.

hasBranch.name: Exhibitions
hasBranch.description: Educational and cultural exhibitions, including science museums, art galleries, and historical displays.

example.name: Discovery Hub
example.description: Hosts rotating science exhibitions that engage visitors of all ages with interactive displays and cutting-edge technology.

hasBranch.name: Retail
hasBranch.description: A retail space with attractions and kids playgrounds offering merchandise, themed products, and local goods.

example.name: Market Street
example.description: A bustling retail avenue offering everything from exclusive theme park merchandise to local artisan crafts.

hasBranch.name: Shows
hasBranch.description: Live performances and entertainment, including theatre productions, concerts, and special events.

example.name: Grand Stage
example.description: A premier venue for live concerts and theatrical performances, featuring state-of-the-art sound and lighting.

hasBranch.name: Wildlife
hasBranch.description: Zoological parks or areas within amusement parks where visitors can interact with or view animals.

example.name: Safari Adventures
example.description: A vast wildlife park where guests can go on safari to see and learn about exotic animals in a semi-natural habitat.
